alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Hardin; Henderson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 9:52PM CDT until April 01 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN HENDERSON...NORTHERN HARDIN AND SOUTHERN DECATUR COUNTIES... At 951 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Morris Chapel, or 10 miles northwest of Savannah, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Tornado, quarter size hail, and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. At 949 PM CDT, power flashes were reported north of Adamsville. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Savannah, Adamsville, Decaturville, Sardis, Olive Hill, Morris Chapel, Montgomery, Crump, Scotts Hill, Saltillo, Milledgeville, Right, Phillips, Haney, Hinkle, Pleasant Grove, Red Walnut, Olivehill, Cerro Gordo and Thurman. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a storm shelter or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
